p: After entering into host cells, SARS-CoV2 releases its contents into host cells (known as uncoating of the genome). The viral RNA enters the host cell nucleus, and the virus uses the host cellsâ€™ established metabolic mechanisms for replication. After replicating, the mRNA of the virus is translated into viral proteins (biosynthesis phase), then the viral particles are assembled (maturation phase) and released ( Yuki et al., 2020).
